file_content.text: We will instruct you further when you are ready to depart Quesh.
We are impressed. You are worthy to be the Emperor's Wrath.
You've got to the count of three to explain yourself.
I'm not in the mood for games.
We are your ally, friend.
Tell me what's become of Quinn?
Did my companion die?
His injuries were devastating, but we restored him to full health. He arrives now with my second.
Tell me what's become of Vette.
Did my companion die?
The Twi'lek was on death's door, but we restored her. She returns now with my second.
Tell me what's become of Jaesa.
Did my companion die?
Her will to live is strong. We restored her fully. My second returns with her now.
Tell me what's become of Broonmark.
Did my companion die?
We restored your creature to full health. My second returns with the one you call Broonmark.
Tell me what's become of Pierce.
Did my companion die?
The soldier nearly perished, but we restored him fully. My second returns with Lieutenant Pierce now.
Baras and Lord Draahg played me. How impressive is that?
I was duped.
The trap was masterful. But the consequences were averted.
All I want to know is whether you'll help me kill Darth Baras and Lord Draahg.
I want revenge!
Our purpose coincides with that desire exactly.
Here, I will prove it. We saved your associate from death....
I'm so relieved you're alive! I thought I--I thought we'd lost you, my lord.
My lord, it is a great relief to see you alive.
I cannot believe Darth Baras betrayed you. I did not anticipate the move.
You're alive! These clowns wouldn't tell me anything, and I assumed the worst!
Nice to see you in one piece. These guys have great hospitality.
So, wow, old man Baras pulled the plug on us, huh? Didn't see that coming.
Oh. You survived. Wonderful. Well, I guess the bright side is I'm not stranded on this war-torn planet.
Must really irk you to have the old man play you like that. Sure didn't see that coming.
It caught us both by surprise.
Nor I.
The betrayer flourishes deceit.
At some point, one of us would have turned on the other.
It was inevitable.
The betrayer snips before you blossom.
It is an incredible relief to see you alive.
These beings allowed me to scan them, and I'm confident in their trustworthiness.
I appreciate the insight, Jaesa.
Good to know.
Her power adds certainty to the Wrath.
Your powers failed to warn me about the trap.
You didn't see Baras coming.
The betrayer is pure and undetectable.
Stand aside. Let me converse with our new friends.
I'll be the judge of that.
Master, you live! I'm filled with desire--for blood; for vengeance; for you.
Master, I thirst for revenge.
I used my power on these beings, and they definitely have contempt for Darth Baras.
Good, you lived. What's our plan for revenge?
We will utterly destroy Darth Baras.
It will be severe.
We met death and returned. We must now enact our revenge!
You took the words out of my mouth.
Definitely.
Only the Wrath can bury the betrayer.
We must consider the best course of action.
Don't be so hasty.
The Wrath is steady before whirling.
Silence. I must speak with our mysterious new friends.
Stay quiet.
We wish to release the Wrath.
Look on me. I am Servant One; this is Servant Two. We are the Emperor's Hand.
The Dark Council runs blind. We alone oversee the Emperor's will in the galaxy.
What does that have to do with me?
Why are we talking?
You have been called.
Greetings.
We sampled the Wrath some time ago.
Am I supposed to be impressed?
Big deal.
It is the Wrath that makes the lasting impression.
The Emperor tasks the Hand with a great undertaking, and you are to become his Wrath.
Darth Baras seizes power against the Emperor's wishes. He must be stopped.
All of my resources are dedicated to Baras's destruction.
Sign me up.
The betrayer has motivated the Wrath.
Why do you need me to handle this?
Can't the Emperor do it?
An empty hand can only slap.
What exactly is Baras up to?
From doing what?
The betrayer plays emperor.
Since the Treaty of Coruscant, the Emperor has withdrawn from the known galaxy, preparing for a great calling.
Baras learned of this and now claims the Emperor speaks through him.
If the Dark Council declares him the Voice of the Emperor, he will have supreme power over the Empire.
What is the Voice of the Emperor?
The Voice?
The Voice is the conduit for the Emperor's words.
That's a scary thought.
Not good.
Wrath can be fueled by fear.
The Emperor chooses one being to physically embody. This being is the Voice. It is obeyed as the Emperor himself.
Why would the Dark Council give Baras that power?
Will the council do that?
The ring of the Sith is tarnished.
The Dark Council has been waiting for word from the Voice. Many are desperate for it to speak again.
But the true Voice has been silenced.
And in its absence, there is nothing to deny Baras's claim.
Some on the council truly believe; others see an advantage in supporting him; and Baras plots against those who oppose him.
The threat dies when Baras dies.
Just send me to kill him.
He is too powerful to confront now.
Am I to defend those who defy him?
We must support his enemies.
Eventually.
I will kill all who join him.
His supporters must die.
That would be wasteful.
The Wrath must build before reaching pitch.
Your crew awaits at your ship. They have been informed of these developments.
Your crew awaits you at your ship. They have been informed of these developments.
Baras means to force the council to bow. But he believes you to be dead. That is our advantage.
Return to your ship, and we will advise you what can be done to thwart him.
